intro: Lamprothyrsus hieronymi var. tinctus, commonly known as the red-leaved ironwood, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its striking red or purple foliage, which contrasts with its dark green stems. The plant belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other economically important species such as the cashew and mango. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its unique leaf coloration makes it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
